choices.B:
UCS: four-port back-to-back PortChannel between IOM and fabric interconnect
Storage: two-port SAN-PortChannel from each SAN controller to each fabric interconnect
choices.D:
UCS: four-port PortChannel from each IOM to each fabric interconnect
Storage: four-port SAN-PortChannel from each SAN controller to each fabric interconnect
choices.A:
UCS: Qty four 802.1q trunks from each IOM to each fabric interconnect
Storage: Qty two Fibre Channel links from each SAN controller to each fabric interconnect
choices.C:
UCS: two-port PortChannel from each IOM to each fabric interconnect
Storage: Qty four Fibre Channel links from each SAN controller to each fabric interconnect

questions.question_text:
An engineer must design the compute portion of a data center environment. The environment includes:
• direct-attach Fibre Channel storage array with four 32 G Fibre Channel ports per controller
• Cisco UCS B-series servers equipped with Cisco UCS IOM 2408 Fabric Extenders
• Cisco 6454 Fabric Interconnects

The fabric interconnects connect to the LAN via 100G ports, the SAN via 32 G Fibre Channel ports, and the IOM 2408 via 10 G ports. Which storage connectivity strategy must the engineer choose?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Has to be C. Only MDS and NXOS support san-port-channel. Direct attach storage does not.
Agree on C for this one.

Selected Answer: C
2 for IOM 
4 for Fiber Channel

choices.C: Host Bus Adapter Extended Receiver Ready

questions.question_text:
A SAN engineer needs to design a Fibre Channel SAN by using Cisco MDS 9000 Series Switches. The solution must meet these requirements:
• ensure storage resilience
• prevent oversubscription
• mitigate congestion on ISL connections
• use virtual links
• support E Ports

Which MDS switch feature should be used to meet these requirements?
Which two statements describe Ethernet switching mode on Cisco UCS 6100 Series Fabric Interconnects? (Choose two.)

choices.E: STP runs on the server ports.
choices.C: The STP parameter configuration is unsupported.
choices.D: The STP parameter configuration is supported.
choices.B: STP runs on the uplink ports of each VLAN, as defined by MSTP.
choices.A: STP runs on the uplink ports of each VLAN, as defined by PVSTP+.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
It is my understanding that IPv6 virtual routers support only VRRPv3. The default is version 2 which only supports IPv4 addresses.

questions.question_text:
A network engineer needs to design a highly available data center to meet these requirements:
• ensure network resilience
• reduce network instability for Layer 3 gateway devices
• provide interoperability in multivendor environments
• support IPv4 and IPv6 address families

Which FHRP meets these requirements?

choices.B:
VPC+ between the two Nexus 5500 -
Enhanced VPC between Nexus 5500 and Nexus 2K
choices.A:
VPC between the two Nexus 5500 -
VPC+ between Nexus 5500 and Nexus 2K
choices.C:
VPC between the two Nexus 5500 and 7K
Enhanced VPC between the two Nexus 5500
choices.D:
VPC+ between the two Nexus 5500 -
VPC between Nexus 5500 and Nexus 2K

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer is designing a new data center for a customer using Cisco proprietary technology. The engineer must ensure the highest availability and bandwidth for south-to-north traffic. Which design must the engineer choose to meet these criteria?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
VPC+ between the two Nexus 5500 switches: This configuration provides high availability and load balancing between the two Nexus 5500 switches. It ensures that if one switch fails, the other can take over its traffic.
Enhanced VPC between Nexus 5500 and Nexus 2K switches: This configuration extends the benefits of VPC to the uplink connections between the Nexus 5500 and Nexus 2K switches, further enhancing availability and load balancing.
I'll go with B here, Enhanced for FEX and VPC+ for HA, Redundancy, BW
